answers.author: Elizabeth Fields
answers.text:
Don't get hung up on titles or grade levels.  Pick people with an interest and an aptitude for what the team will be doing.  I would suggest approaching your department directors individually and in person to discuss who would best represent their departments.  If the team is viewed as just another additional duty by the members, chances of success are slim.

author: Lisa Gilliam
text: I have been asked to start a Marketing Team comprised of representatives from our various County departments. This team would help to identify citizen-focused, newsworthy ideas that I would then use for news releases, the website, social media posts, newsletters, etc. As an organization without an official Marketing Department, I am looking for ideas on the best way to go about organizing this team. Any suggestions? Has anyone had success with a similar setup?
title: Internal Marketing Team Development
